title: 【やさしい日本語】61年(ねん)の 間(あいだ) 続(つづ)いた 福岡市(ふくおかし)の ロシア料理(りょうり)の 店(みせ)が 閉(し)まる
cleaned_sentences: There is a Russian restaurant called "Tundra" in Tenjin, Fukuoka City.
The owner of the store is 77-year-old Tokunaga.
Tokunaga's mother started the store 61 years ago.
Apparently he learned how to make it at a Russian restaurant in Tokyo.
There were few foreign restaurants serving food, so "tundra" quickly became popular.
Tokunaga said, "It may have been a long time because it hasn't changed the taste."
However, the store has been getting tough recently.
My mother and the person who helped out with the store have passed away.
I can't find anyone to continue the store after Tokunaga.
The rent for the store is likely to be higher as well.
Tokunaga decided to close his store on May 7th.
Tokunaga said, "I want to make dishes that both adults and children can say are "delicious" until the end."
